{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2983447,"name":"Rohan Nambiar","username":"rohan_nambiar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rohan_nambiar/{size}/176372_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-27T09:33:34.695Z","cooked":"

Thought I’d drop these here … this is the clever little system we use to attach our handles to our robot. It keeps them secure but still easy to remove before a match.

—
Google Drive Folder

Do you put something like this on the robot? How many?

Isn’t it large and heavy, compared with other means of fastening the bumper to the frame?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2021-12-27T13:32:05.240Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":326,"readers_count":325,"score":120.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":398398,"topic_slug":"seatbelt-buckle-handle-attachment","display_username":"Richard Wallace","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1549,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I live for the details."},"post_url":"/t/seatbelt-buckle-handle-attachment/398398/3","custom_user_title":"I live for the details.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2983460,"name":"Rohan Nambiar","username":"rohan_nambiar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rohan_nambiar/{size}/176372_2.png","created_at":"2021-12-27T14:01:06.958Z","cooked":"

Sorry, I think I copied and pasted the wrong description! These files are for our attachment system for our handles.

We have a different attachment system for our bumpers. Maybe that makes more sense?

We have handles that we use to carry the robot on and off the field … they’re much easier than carrying the robot by the frame.

We use kayak handles on a carabiner George Clips. The best way to move your robot

We have used similar home-made handles like this for several years and found them very handy and effective. Just make sure they don’t fall into moving mechanisms like drive train chains/belts while testing.
